title: Yeast cells in sugar solution graph

content.description:
Directions: Answers must be in essay form. Outline form is not acceptable. Labeled diagrams may be used to supplement discussion, but in no case will a diagram alone suffice. It is important that you read each question completely before you begin.

Yeast cells are placed in an apparatus with a solution of sugar (a major nutrient for yeast metabolism). The apparatus detects bubbles of gas released by the yeast cells. The rate of respiration varies with the surrounding temperatures as indicated by the data below.
content.question: Graph the results on the axes provided. Determine the optimum temperature for respiration in the yeast.

frqParts.text: Graph the results on the axes provided. Determine the optimum temperature for respiration in the yeast.

skill.text: 1.C: Explain biological concepts and processes in applied contexts.
